Class Scoreboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jogamp.java3d.SceneGraphObject

            • objects.Scoreboard

  • public class Scoreboard
extends org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup
    A score board object to place in your scene

    • Field Detail

      • dials

        private org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup[] dials
        The transform groups for each dial

      • digitValues

        private int[] digitValues
        The current value of each digit.
        Digits 2,1,0 are player 1 while digits 5,4,3 are player 2

      • da

        private static final float da
        The angle between each symbol on a dial
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • rerps

        private org.jogamp.java3d.RotationInterpolator[] rerps
        The rotation interpolators for each digit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scoreboard

        public Scoreboard(org.jogamp.vecmath.Vector3d p)
        Only constructor. Only needs a position vector.
        Creates a fricken time machine that you can increment the score of.
        Parameters:
        p - The position the centre of this machine should be at

    • Method Detail

      • scoreP1

        public void scoreP1()
        Scores a point for player 1.

        Increases the score for player 1 by 1, by rotating the dial to the next digit and carrying when necessary.

      • scoreP2

        public void scoreP2()
        Scores a point for player 2.

        Increases the score for player 2 by 1, by rotating the dial to the next digit and carrying when necessary.

      • changeRerp

        private void changeRerp(int index)
        Updates the rotation interpolator at the given index to rotate to the next digit for the dial of the same index.
        Parameters:
        index - The dial index to increment

      • getCurrentAngle

        private static float getCurrentAngle(org.jogamp.java3d.RotationInterpolator r)
        Calculates the angle the given rotation interpolator is currently at, based on it's alpha.
        Parameters:
        r - The rotation interpolator to check
        Returns:
        The current angle of the rerp: [0.0, 2pi)

      • createRerp

        private org.jogamp.java3d.RotationInterpolator createRerp(org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup target)
        Creates a rotation interpolator with blank values for the given transform group.
        Parameters:
        target - The target transformgroup to rotate
        Returns:
        The newly created rotation interpolator

      • createBoard

        private void createBoard()
        Creates the the whole thing assigns the references to the appropriate members.

      • createDial

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup createDial(org.jogamp.vecmath.Color3f bgclr)
        Creates a dial object for use in our score board.
        The dial is a 10 sided polygon with digit symbols on each side.
        Check createSide(Color3f) to figure out the dimensions of the shape.
        Parameters:
        bgclr - The colour of the dial, not the digit symbol
        Returns:
        A new transform group containing the digits and sides

      • createText3D

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup createText3D(java.lang.String text,
                                                             org.jogamp.vecmath.Color3f clr)
        Static method to create 3D text of the given text and colour.

        The text should be roughly centred, really flat, and 0.2 tall.

        Parameters:
        text - The string the text should say
        clr - The colour of the text
        Returns:
        The new transform group containing the text. Don't change it's transform.

      • createSide

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.Shape3D createSide(org.jogamp.vecmath.Color3f clr)
        Creates a rectangle of ratio 1:2 for making the 10 sided polygon that is the dial.
        Parameters:
        clr - The colour of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The newly created shape3d of the rectangle

      • createBoard

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup createBoard(float factor)
        Creates the inner margin of the backboard
        Parameters:
        factor - A multiplier to scale the size
        Returns:
        The new transformgroup containing the new shape

      • edge

        private static org.jogamp.java3d.TransformGroup edge(float factor)
        Creates the outer padding of the backboard
        Parameters:
        factor - Scalar multiplier to scale the size
        Returns:
        The new transformgroup containing the new shape
